content: mug cozy because it s fall ya ll materials ● scraps of dk weight yarn the patterns used 15g or less of yarn per cozy adriafil knitcol also makes beautiful cozies ● f hook ● tapestry needle ● a mug these mug cozies were designed for a standard mug size they are easily adjustable for larger mugs - just continue to work in pattern until the cozy when placed around the mug is approx 1 ½ inches from the handle negative ease the cozy is secured around the handle with 2 loops on each end of the cozy have fun with color make them solid colors or change colors whenever you want i used multiple colors in these as i was using very small amounts of scrap and would run out of a color instructions pattern 1 just a little bean bean stitch insert hook into next st pull up a loop yo insert hook into same st and pull up a loop 4 loops yo insert hook into same st and pull up a loop 6 loops yo and pull through all 6 loops ch1 chain 28 15 for the strap and 13 for the cozy june nemeth designs 1 row 1 1 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook 1 single_crochet in the next 11 chains ch1 turn 12 single_crochet the remaining unworked chains will be one of the loops that will go around the handle to secure your cozy you will create the other loop after the body of the cozy is complete row 2 single_crochet in 1st st ch1 *sk1 bean st in next st repeat from * to last st single_crochet in last st ch1 turn 5 bean sts 2 single_crochet throughout row 3 single_crochet in first st bean st in the bean st of the row below not the ch1 space and in each bean st across single_crochet in last st ch1 turn repeat row 3 until the piece is approx 1 5 from the handle when wrapped around the mug last row 1 single_crochet in each st across in each single_crochet ch1 space and bean 12 single_crochet ch15 fasten_off leaving a tail for sewing move on to the finishing section pattern 2 small granny chain 28 15 for the strap and 13 for the cozy row 1 half_double_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and in the next 11 chains 12 half_double_crochet now and throughout turn the remaining unworked chains will be one of the loops that will go around the handle to secure your cozy you will create the other loop after the body of the cozy is complete row 2 ch1 2 half_double_crochet in 1st st *ch1 skip 1 2 half_double_crochet in next st repeat from * to last 3 sts skip 1 st half_double_crochet in the next 2 sts turn row 3 ch2 counts as ch1 + ch1 space throughout 2 half_double_crochet in first chain space *ch1 2 half_double_crochet in next chain space repeat from * to last 2 sts 1 half_double_crochet
